title: Ticket #6759: Improve new JobEventLog API before release
description:
The current JobEventLog interface is not very Pythonic, and on further reflection, way more complicated than it needs to be. Instead: 

class JobEventLog:
    # Raises IOError if we can't initialize the log reader for filename.
    __init__(filename)
    # Returns the next event in the log, if any become available before the deadline.
    __next__()
    # Returns self, so that this class functions like file iterators (where
    # iterators don't maintain their own seek pointer).
    __iter__()
    # Sets self's deadline and then returns self.
    events(deadline=None)

This is the interface we actually wanted, more or less, eliminates a lot of functions, and is more Pythonic than the previous API. Example usage: 

import os
import htcondor
from htcondor import JobEventType

jel = htcondor.JobEventLog("logfile")
# Stop waiting for events sixty seconds from now.
for event in jel.events(deadline=+60):
    if event.type == JobEventType.EXECUTE:
        break;
else:
    print("Failed to find execute event before deadline, aborting.")
    sys.exit(-1)

# Do something else.

# Stop waiting for events ninety seconds from now.
for event in jel.events(deadline=+90):
    if event.type == JobEventType.JOB_TERMINATED:
        break;
else:
    print("Failed to find terminated event before deadline, aborting.")
    sys.exit(-1)
remarks:
2018-Sep-13 13:29:40 by tlmiller:
None of us (TJ, ToddM, or Mark) are super happy about 'events()' and 'deadline', but we also can't come up with anything better. (The main argument in favor of deadline is that -- despite it not being an absolute value for coding convenience reasons -- is (a) it sounds more like (if not quite enough) it applies to the whole sequence of events and (b) "a deadline of None" pretty clearly means "no deadline".)

2018-Sep-13 13:30:19 by tlmiller:
The above example should probably go into the documentation (for #6736).

2018-Sep-13 16:40:15 by tlmiller:
Since this API is new for 8.7.10, no further documentation is necessary.
